Class RoiLogics

  • java.lang.Object
    • RoiLogics

  • public class RoiLogics
extends java.lang.Object
    Class with static utility functions for handling Rois and also accessing imageJ's roiManager
    Author:
    Thomas Braschler, Zahra Sadat Ghazali

    • Field Summary

                              int foreground,
                              int background)
        Fill the holes in a binary mask
        Parameters:
        ip - Image processor holding the masks
        foreground - The forground level (with which to fill the holes)
        background - the background level

      • drawPolygonArrayToMask

        public static void drawPolygonArrayToMask(java.awt.Polygon[] pols,
                                          ij.process.ByteProcessor bp,
                                          java.awt.Color col)
        Draw an array of polygons to a binary mask; the interior of the polygons will be filled with the specified color, the remainder of the surface remains however it was
        Parameters:
        pols - The polygons to be drawn
        bp - A byteProcessor, contains the image onto which the polygons are drawn
        col - Color for the interior of the polygons

      • growPolygon

        public static java.awt.Polygon growPolygon(java.awt.Polygon pol,
                                           ij.process.ImageProcessor maskAllowedPixels)
        Grows a polygon by pixel, but only into areas that are white on the mask
        Parameters:
        pol - The polygon to grow (dilate)
        maskAllowedPixels - The mask defining the allowable growth areas
        Returns:
        Polygon dilated by one pixel

      • growPolygon

        public static java.awt.Polygon growPolygon(java.awt.Polygon pol,
                                           ij.process.ImageProcessor maskAllowedPixels,
                                           java.awt.Polygon[] polygons_to_avoid)
        Grows a polygon by a pixel, respecting the white areas on the mask and also avoiding the other polygons
        Parameters:
        pol - The polygon to be grown (the polygon itself is not changed, the resulting polygon is a new one)
        maskAllowedPixels - 0/255 values to indicate the forbidden and allowed areas
        polygons_to_avoid - An array of polygons to be avoided while growing
        Returns:
        The polygon grown by a pixel

      • growPolygons

        public static void growPolygons(java.awt.Polygon[] pols,
                                ij.process.ImageProcessor allowedProcessor,
                                boolean avoidNeighbors,
                                int nSteps,
                                ij.gui.ProgressBar bp)
        Grow polygons
        Parameters:
        pols - An array of polygons
        allowedProcessor - The image Processor to use
        avoidNeighbors - Does a growing polygon have to avoid geometric neighbors during growth?
        nSteps - How many pixels to grow?
        bp - Reference to progress bar to show progress

      • maskFromPolygon

        public static ij.process.ByteProcessor maskFromPolygon(java.awt.Polygon pol,
                                                       int width,
                                                       int height)
        Convert a polygon to a binary mask in rectangular image (white pixels on black background)
        Parameters:
        pol - The polygon
        width - Width of the image to be created
        height - Height of the image to be created
        Returns:
        ByteProcessor containing the mask

      • polygonFromMask

        public static java.awt.Polygon polygonFromMask(ij.process.ByteProcessor theMask)
        Convert a binary mask to a polygon
        Parameters:
        theMask - ByteProcessor containing the mask (white pixels = selected)
        Returns:
        Polygon obtained from the mask

      • reactangleOverlapsWithImage

        public static boolean reactangleOverlapsWithImage(java.awt.Rectangle r,
                                                  int width,
                                                  int height)
        Does a given rectangle overlap at least partially with an image of given width and height?
        Parameters:
        r - The rectangle for testing overlap
        width - The width of the image (image goes from 0 to width, interval edges included)
        height - The height of the image (image goes from 0 to width, interval edges included)
        Returns:
        Whether or not there is overlap

        Parameters:

      • intWithLeadingZeroes

        public static java.lang.String intWithLeadingZeroes(int num,
                                                    int maximum)
        Helper function for making a string from an int
        Parameters:
        num - The integer number
        maximum - Highest number to be shown, to define the number of necessary leading zeroes
        Returns:
        string-formatted number

      • restrictRoiToMask

        public static ij.gui.Roi restrictRoiToMask(ij.gui.Roi theRoi,
                                           ij.process.ImageProcessor ip)
        Keep only the parts of a ROI that are within the area defined by a mask
        Parameters:
        theRoi - The ROI to be trimmed to the mask area

        Returns:
        the trimmed ROI
